sites.name: The Golden Roof (Goldenes Dachl)
sites.description: A landmark in Innsbruck, the Golden Roof is a late Gothic oriel with a roof covered with 2,738 fire-gilded copper tiles.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visible year-round from the outside.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours available for related museum.

sites.name: Hofburg Palace
sites.description: Once the residence of the Tyrolean sovereigns, this palace is a remarkable example of Baroque architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; consider seasonal exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Consider buying tickets online to skip the queue.

sites.name: Bergisel Ski Jump
sites.description: A modern architectural marvel offering panoramic views of Innsbruck and the surrounding mountains.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for ski jumping events or training schedules.
sites.booking_tips: Combine your visit with a tour of the surrounding Olympic venues.

sites.name: Tyrolean State Museum (Ferdinandeum)
sites.description: Explore Tyrolean art and history from prehistoric times to the present at this comprehensive museum.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for temporary exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Check for temporary exhibitions and special events.

sites.name: Innsbruck Cathedral (Dom zu St. Jakob)
sites.description: A stunning Baroque cathedral known for its impressive ceiling frescoes and opulent altar.
sites.seasonal_notes: Respect service times if visiting.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours are available; check times in advance.

sites.name: Swarovski Crystal Worlds
sites.description: A magical experience showcasing the brilliance of crystal in a series of artistic installations. Located slightly outside Innsbruck in Wattens.
sites.seasonal_notes: Garden installations may vary by season.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for discounts and express entry. Consider the shuttle bus from Innsbruck.

sites.name: Nordkette Cable Car
sites.description: Take the cable car from Innsbruck to the top of the Nordkette for stunning views over the city and mountains.
sites.seasonal_notes: Weather dependent; check conditions before going up. Hiking options available in summer.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be bought at the station or online. Consider Innsbruck Card for potential discounts.

sites.name: Tyrolean Folk Art Museum
sites.description: Discover a rich collection of Tyrolean cultural artifacts, from traditional costumes to handmade objects.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Check for guided tours and special exhibitions. Can be combined with Hofkirche ticket.

sites.name: Alpenzoo Innsbruck
sites.description: Europe's highest-altitude zoo featuring alpine animals including bears, wolves, ibex, and eagles in naturalistic habitats.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, but animals are more active in spring and fall.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online; consider combining with the Hungerburgbahn funicular for easy access.

sites.name: Court Church (Hofkirche)
sites.description: Gothic church housing the impressive cenotaph of Emperor Maximilian I, surrounded by 28 bronze statues of his ancestors and heroes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded in winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Combined ticket available with Folk Art Museum. Audio guides recommended.

sites.name: Ambras Castle
sites.description: Renaissance castle with beautiful gardens, featuring a notable collection of armor, art, and curiosities collected by Archduke Ferdinand II.
sites.seasonal_notes: Gardens best visited in summer; castle open year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Spend time in both the Upper and Lower Castle. Audio guides available.

sites.name: Maria-Theresien-Straße
sites.description: Innsbruck's elegant main street with impressive Baroque and Rococo buildings, upscale shops, cafes, and the iconic Annasäule (St. Anne's Column).
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful Christmas markets in winter; outdoor cafes in summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking needed. Great for photos with mountain backdrop.

sites.name: Triumphal Arch (Triumphpforte)
sites.description: Historic marble arch built in 1765 to commemorate the marriage of Leopold II and the death of Emperor Francis I.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visible year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early for best photographs.

sites.name: Innsbruck Old Town (Altstadt)
sites.description: Medieval old town center with colorful buildings, narrow streets, charming squares, and historical landmarks including the Golden Roof.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round; Christmas markets in winter; less crowded in spring and fall.
sites.booking_tips: Consider a guided walking tour to learn about the history. Best explored on foot.

sites.name: Tirol Panorama Museum
sites.description: Museum featuring a stunning 360-degree panoramic painting depicting the Tyrolean battle for freedom against Napoleonic troops in 1809.
sites.seasonal_notes: Can be combined with Bergisel Ski Jump visit.
sites.booking_tips: Combined ticket available with Bergisel. Audio guides recommended.

sites.name: Imperial Palace (Kaiserliche Hofburg)
sites.description: Former Habsburg imperial palace featuring luxurious apartments, grand halls, and an impressive portrait gallery.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with seasonal exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Consider the combination ticket with other imperial attractions. Audio guides available.

sites.name: Patscherkofel Mountain
sites.description: Popular local mountain with hiking trails, ski slopes, and panoramic views of Innsbruck and the surrounding Alpine peaks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Winter for skiing; summer for hiking; autumn for fall colors.
sites.booking_tips: Take the cable car for easy access. Check weather conditions before visiting.

sites.name: Audioversum Sound Museum
sites.description: Interactive science center dedicated to the phenomenon of hearing, sound, and music with hands-on exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Good for rainy days; suitable for families.
sites.booking_tips: Check for special workshops and interactive sessions.

sites.name: Tyrolean State Theatre (Tiroler Landestheater)
sites.description: Principal performing arts venue in Innsbruck offering opera, ballet, and theatrical performances in a historic setting.
sites.seasonal_notes: Season runs September through June.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular performances. Check current program online.

sites.name: Bell Museum (Glockenmuseum)
sites.description: Unique museum in Grassmayr Bell Foundry showcasing the centuries-old tradition of bell casting with impressive historical exhibits.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special events during local festivals.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours available at specific times. Check for bell casting demonstrations.

sites.name: Botanical Garden Innsbruck
sites.description: University-managed gardens featuring alpine plants, tropical greenhouses, and diverse plant collections with mountain views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in late spring and summer for most blooms.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Check opening hours as they vary seasonally.
